{"step_by_step_thinking": "The curve of occlusion refers to the curvature of the teeth when the jaws are closed. The curve of occlusion touching the buccal and lingual surfaces of mandibular buccal cuspal teeth is called as the Curve of Wilson. The Curve of Spee refers to the curvature of the occlusal plane from the anterior teeth to the posterior teeth. The Curve of Monsoon and Catenary curve are not related to the occlusion of teeth.", "answer_choice": "A"}
